1.Question: You need to connect your company’s on-premise network into AWS and would like to establish an AWS managed VPN service. Which of the following configuration items needs to be setup on the Amazon VPC side of the connection?

2.Question: Which of the following statements about AWS’s pay-as-you-go pricing model is correct?
Choices: It results in reduced capital expenditures
It is relevant only for Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, and Amazon DynamoDB
It requires payment up front for AWS services

3.Question: The AWS Cost Management tools give users the ability to do which of the following? (Select TWO.)
Choices: Switch automatically to Reserved Instances or Spot Instances, whichever is most cost-effective
Break down AWS costs by day, service, and linked AWS account
Move data stored in Amazon S3 to a more cost-effective storage class
Create budgets and receive notifications if current or forecasted usage exceeds the budgets
Terminate any AWS resource automatically if budget thresholds are exceeded

4.Question: Which type of AWS database is ideally suited to analytics using SQL queries?

5.Question: Which service allows you to monitor and troubleshoot systems using system and application log files generated by those systems?

6.Question: Which of the authentication options below can be used to authenticate using AWS APIs? (Select TWO.)

7.Question: Which of the following are NOT features of AWS IAM? (Select TWO.)
Choices: Shared access to your AWS account

8.Question: What is the easiest way to store a backup of an EBS volume on Amazon S3?
Choices: Write a custom script to copy the data into a bucket
Use Amazon Kinesis to process the data and store the results in S3
Create a snapshot of the volume
Use S3 lifecycle actions to backup the volume

9.Question: Which type of scaling does Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling provide?

10.Question: What is an example of scaling vertically?
Choices: AWS Lambda adding concurrently executing functions
Adding read replicas to an Amazon RDS database
Increasing the instance size with Amazon RDS
AWS Auto Scaling adding more EC2 instances

11.Question: Based on the shared responsibility model, which of the following security and compliance tasks is AWS responsible for?
Choices: Granting access to individuals and services

13.Question: What do you need to log into the AWS console?

14.Question: How can a company facilitate the sharing of data over private connections between two accounts they own within a region?

15.Question: Where do Amazon Identity and Access Management (IAM) accounts need to be created for a global organization?
Choices: In each geographical area where the users are located
Just create them once, as IAM is a global service
In each region where the users are located
Create them globally, and then replicate them regionally

17.Question: Which resource should you use to access AWS security and compliance reports?

18.Question: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following tasks are the responsibility of the AWS customer? (Select TWO.)
Choices: Ensuring that access to data centers is restricted
Ensuring that users have received security training in the use of AWS services
Ensuring that hardware is disposed of properly
Ensuring that application data is encrypted at rest
Ensuring that AWS NTP servers are set to the correct time

19.Question: What methods are available for scaling an Amazon RDS database? (Select TWO.)
Choices: You can scale out automatically with EC2 Auto Scaling
You can scale up by increasing storage capacity
You can scale up automatically using AWS Auto Scaling
You can scale up by moving to a larger instance size
You can scale out by implementing Elastic Load Balancing

21.Question: Which AWS service is designed to be used for operational analytics?

22.Question: Which of the following is NOT a best practice for protecting the root user of an AWS account?
Choices: Don’t share the root user credentials
Lock away the AWS root user access keys

24.Question: Which pricing model will interrupt a running Amazon EC2 instance if capacity becomes temporarily unavailable?

25.Question: Your manager has asked you to explain some of the security features available in the AWS cloud. How can you describe the function of Amazon CloudHSM?
Choices: It is a Public Key Infrastructure (PKI)
It provides server-side encryption for S3 objects
It can be used to generate, use and manage encryption keys in the cloud
It is a firewall for use with web applications

26.Question: Which AWS database service is schema-less and can be scaled dynamically without incurring downtime?

27.Question: A Cloud Practitioner is creating the business process workflows associated with an order fulfilment system. Which AWS service can assist with coordinating tasks across distributed application components?

28.Question: What are the advantages of running a database service such as Amazon RDS in the cloud versus deploying on-premise? (Select TWO.)
Choices: You have full control of the operating system and can install your own operational tools
There are no costs for replicating data between DBs in different data centers or regions
Scalability is improved as it is quicker to implement and there is an abundance of capacity
You can use any database software you like, allowing greater flexibility
High availability is easier to implement due to built-in functionality for deploying read replicas and multi-AZ

29.Question: How can a company configure automatic, asynchronous copying of objects in Amazon S3 buckets across regions?
Choices: This is done by default by AWS

31.Question: Where are Amazon EBS snapshots stored?
Choices: On an Amazon EBS instance store

35.Question: What advantages does the AWS cloud provide in relation to cost? (Select TWO.)
Choices: Ability to turn off resources and not pay for them

36.Question: Which AWS security tool uses an agent installed in EC2 instances and assesses applications for vulnerabilities and deviations from best practices?

37.Question: Your manager has asked you to explain the benefits of using IAM groups. Which of the below statements are valid benefits? (Select TWO.)
Choices: Enables you to attach IAM permission policies to more than one user at a time
Groups let you specify permissions for multiple users, which can make it easier to manage the permissions for those users
Provide the ability to nest groups to create an organizational hierarchy
Provide the ability to create custom permission policies
You can restrict access to the subnets in your VPC

Customers are responsible for edge locations
AWS are responsible for networking infrastructure

Choices: Set the user account as a “global” account when created
Create a separate account in IAM within each region in which they will travel
IAM is a global service, just create the users in one place

53.Question: According to the AWS Well-Architected Framework, what change management steps should be taken to achieve reliability in the AWS Cloud? (Select TWO.)
Choices: Use AWS CloudTrail to record AWS API calls into an auditable log file
Use service limits to prevent users from creating or making changes to AWS resources

Use AWS Config to generate an inventory of AWS resources

Choices: Add more CPU/RAM to existing instances as demand increases
Requires a restart to scale up or down

Automatic scaling using services such as AWS Auto Scaling
Scalability is limited by maximum instance size

57.Question: In which ways does AWS’ pricing model benefit organizations?
Choices: Focus spend on capital expenditure, rather than operational expenditure
Reduce the cost of maintaining idle resources
Reduces the people cost of application development

58.Question: Which of the statements below does NOT characterize cloud computing?
Choices: Cloud computing allows you to swap variable expense for capital expense
Cloud computing is the on-demand delivery of compute power
With cloud computing you get to benefit from massive economies of scale
With cloud computing you can increase your speed and agility

Choices: Physical security of data center facilities
Setting up server-side encryption on an Amazon S3 bucket

62.Question: How can you deploy your EC2 instances so that if a single data center fails you still have instances available?

63.Question: A company is using the AWS CLI and programmatic access of AWS resources from its on-premises network.What is a mandatory requirement in this scenario?
Choices: Using an Amazon EC2 key pair
Using an AWS Direct Connect connection
Using an AWS access key and a secret key

64.Question: You are evaluating AWS services that can assist with creating scalable application environments. Which of the statements below best describes the Elastic Load Balancer service?
Choices: A highly available and scalable Domain Name System (DNS) service
A network service that provides an alternative to using the Internet to connect customers’ on-premise sites to AWS
Automatically distributes incoming application traffic across multiple targets, such as Amazon EC2 instances, containers, and IP addresses
Helps you ensure that you have the correct number of Amazon EC2 instances available to handle the load for your application

65.Question: What type of cloud computing service type do AWS Elastic Beanstalk and Amazon RDS correspond to?
